result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Barek J Wentworth

defendant.name: Wentworth, Barek J
defendant.address: 618 S. Barstow Street, Sojourner House, Eau Claire, WI 54701

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Barek J Wentworth
Current: 618 S. Barstow Street, Sojourner House, Eau Claire, WI 54701 United States  (Effective: 10-12-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Eau Claire, WI 54701

(Case called at 11:15 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Barek Wentworth appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Andrew Knaack. ADA Monica Fallon appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant executed. Defendant updates address. Court orders the previously ordered bond remains in effect. 
Hearing: 11/29/2022 at 9:30 AM.
Return on warrant on October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:56 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Barek J Wentworth not in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Barek J Wentworth. Attorney Thorson has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. State requests warrant.

Warrant ordered.

(Cases 22CF1086, 21CF500, 21CF711, 22CF324 are called at 3:43 PM) Defendant Barek J Wentworth in court with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. State indicates that case 22CF1086 should be sent back into intake. Off the record- Counsel schedules 22CF1086 for October 4, 2022 at 9:30 AM returns in intake. 
Defense has received and reviewed the Presentence Investigation- notes corrections for the record. State makes argument for sentence recommendation. Defense makes argument for sentence recommendation. Defendant makes a statement. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 2 years Probation concurrent to each other with the following conditions: 10 days jail or 80 hours of community service in 22CF324 (Defendant chooses Community Service), Court finds the Defendant is eligible for Huber or Electronic Monitoring at the discretion of the jail; Restitution to be determined within 60 days; No contact with M.C. (co-defendant); No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; No entry into any bars, taverns, or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol; Not to consume or possess any alcohol; Not to consume, possess, or use any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia; Not to possess any weapons; AODA and follow through with recommendations; Psychological assessment and follow through with any recommendations; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. 
Court orders in 22CF324- 121 days credit, if revoked; in 21CF711- 23 days credit, if revoked; in 21CF500- 2 days credit, if revoked.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

Conditions:

(11:11 AM case called.) Defendant Barek J Wentworth appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Barek J Wentworth. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
State advises the defendant has other open pending cases in Eau Claire County and requests this case ride along with the others.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 3:45 pm in Branch 3.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
No use or possession of dangerous weapons or knives.
